7684951_syn_1:
Indication: Loculated R effusion.
Procedure: US-guided pigtail placement (32557).
- US loc: 7th ICS.
- Seldinger technique.
- 14Fr catheter placed.
- 850mL turbid fluid drained.
Complications: None.
7684951_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Percutaneous Pleural Drainage with Imaging Guidance.
INDICATION: Complex parapneumonic effusion, Right.
DESCRIPTION: Under real-time ultrasound guidance, the effusion was localized. A needle was advanced into the fluid pocket. A guidewire was passed, the tract dilated, and a 14Fr indwelling catheter was inserted. 850mL of purulent fluid was evacuated. Placement was confirmed via ultrasound.
7684951_syn_3:
Code: 32557.
Description: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter, with imaging guidance.
Method: Ultrasound used for access and placement confirmation.
Device: 14Fr Pigtail.
Output: 850mL.
7684951_syn_4:
Procedure: Chest Tube with US
Steps:
1. US to find spot (Right 7th intercostal).
2. Numbed skin.
3. Needle -> Wire -> Dilator -> Tube.
4. Hooked up to pleur-evac.
5. Drained pus.
Catheter stays in.
7684951_syn_5: patricia moore needs a drain for right side empyema. brought ultrasound in saw the pocket. put a pigtail in using the wire technique. got a lot of junk out like 850ml. stitched it in place. us shows it looks good.
7684951_syn_6: Ultrasound-guided pleural drainage performed on right hemithorax. 14Fr pigtail catheter inserted using Seldinger technique under continuous imaging. 850mL turbid fluid removed. Catheter secured.
7684951_syn_7:
[Indication]
Complex R effusion.
[Anesthesia]
Local + Moderate Sedation.
[Description]
US guidance used. 14Fr catheter inserted into right pleural space. 850mL drained.
[Plan]
Connect to suction. Antibiotics.
7684951_syn_8: [REDACTED] a pocket of infected fluid around her right lung that needed draining. Using an ultrasound machine to guide us, we placed a small tube through her back and into the fluid. We drained about 850mL of cloudy fluid and left the tube in place to keep draining it.
7684951_syn_9:
Procedure: Image-directed thoracostomy.
Action: Utilizing sonographic visualization, a drainage conduit was introduced into the right pleural cavity. Purulent collection was evacuated.
